## Natural history notes

Baldwin's Flatsedge (Cyperus croceus) is a perennial sedge that occurs in a variety of habitats, including forests, wetlands, coastal areas, and disturbed sites. This plant requires a subtropical climate and is primarily found in the southeastern United States. In Florida, it is sometimes considered a weed by landowners and gardeners.
